list_definition.definition: to want something to happen and have some reason to believe that it will or might happen

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He’s very late, but we are still hoping he will come
I hope to be in London next month
We’re hoping for some help from other people
It’s unlikely that he’ll come now, but we keep on hoping
‘Do you think it will rain?’ ‘I hope so/not’.

list_definition.definition: (any reason or encouragement for) the state of feeling that what one wants will or might happen

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He has lost all hope of becoming the president
He came to see me in the hope that I would help him
He has hopes of winning a scholarship
The rescuers said there was no hope of finding anyone alive in the mine.

list_definition.mean_english: người hoặc vật mang lại hy vọng
list_definition.definition: a person, thing etc that one is relying on for help etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He’s my last hope – there is no-one else I can ask.
My hope is that he will get married and settle down soon.

list_ex_of_english: I hope that this will help to explain the many and various definitions of the concept of successful ageing.
Archaeologists study the former in the hope of understanding the latter.
Internally caudillo warfare had set back any hopes of a truly national identity.
In a specific, technical sense, its hopes were not realized.
However, one might hope that the chapter prefaces or book structure would highlight key points of debate so that instructors and students could assess them.
We hope that this paper will go some way to raising awareness of the possibilities for exploiting this work.
I hope they're not all going to be driving pick-ups like yours.
We hope that readers will benefit from this exchange as much as we have.
